segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, mahāpathavī parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya ṭhapetvā satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose the great earth was worn away and eroded except for seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds.

segments.pli: katamaṃ nu kho bahutaraṃ—yaṃ vā mahāpathaviyā parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādinnaṃ, yā vā satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā avasiṭṭhā”ti?
segments.en: Which is more: the great earth that has been worn away and eroded, or the seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds that are left?”

segments.pli: “Etadeva, bhante, bahutaraṃ mahāpathaviyā yadidaṃ parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādinnaṃ; appamattikā satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā avasiṭṭhā.
segments.en: “Sir, the great earth that has been worn away and eroded is certainly more. The seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds are tiny.

segments.pli: Saṅkhampi na upenti, upanidhampi na upenti, kalabhāgampi na upenti mahāpathaviyā parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādinnaṃ upanidhāya satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā avasiṭṭhā”ti.
segments.en: Compared to the great earth that has been worn away and eroded, they can’t be reckoned or compared, they’re not even a fraction.”
“In the same way, for a noble disciple …
That’s why you should practice meditation …”

suttaplex.blurb: As a few jujube seeds compared to the great earth, so is the suffering remaining to one who has seen the four noble truths.
